entrydata.name: ShortDescription
entrydata.text: Bridge Rehabilitation of Allen Road Underpass at Lawrence Avenue West (Bridge ID197)

entrydata.name: Description
entrydata.text: The project involves the rehabilitation of the William R. Allen Road Underpass at Lawrence Avenue West (Bridge ID197) including but not limited to, substructure and superstructure repairs including paving and waterproofing, reconstruction of sidewalks and parapet/median barrier walls, replacement of expansion joints, installation of temporary signals and traffic/pedestrian control, new light poles and bases, concrete repairs including sealing and crack injection. As further described in Part 3 (DRAWINGS AND SPECIFICATIONS) and Part 2 the Contract (the "Project").

textlist.text: Summary

entrydata.name: SiteMeeting
entrydata.text: RFT Optional PreBid Information Meetings will take place at 10:00 AM, local time on January 25, 2024 at the TTC facilities below the bridge where concrete delamination removal is required at the south entrance of the station on Lawrence Ave. Site meetings will not be available at any other times. Suppliers who show up 15 minutes or later will not be permitted.

entrydata.name: ShortDescription
entrydata.text: Request for Tenders for Commissioners Transfer Station and Ingram Yard Buildings Roof Membrane Replacement

textlist.text: Contractor’s Scope of work generally includes but is not limited to:
1. At Commissioners Transfer Station: the removal and replacement of the roof membrane system;
and
2. At Ingram Collection Yard: the removal, storage, reinstallation and
commissioning of the photovoltaic system, and the removal and replacement of the roof membrane system.
The details of the Works are as described in the Specifications and
Drawings and RFT document.
Summary
Suppliers are required to attend both mandatory site meetings to familiarize themselves with the Project and ascertain the full extent of the Work required.

The mandatory site meetings will take place at Commissioners Transfer Station – 400 Commissioners Street, Toronto local time on February 01, 2024 at 10AM, and at Ingram Yard – 86 Ingram Drive, Toronto local time on February 01, 2024 at 12PM.
Site meetings will not be available at any other times.
Suppliers must sign the attendance sheet at both mandatory site meetings during the designated dates and times for their Bid to be considered.

entrydata.name: ShortDescription
entrydata.text: Scarborough Pumping Station Rehabilitation and New Atmospheric Surge Tank

textlist.text: Scarborough Pumping Station and Reservoir
The work to be carried out consists of;
Rehabilitation of the Scarborough Pumping Station including:
- the conversion of an existing wet well into a dry well and new piping gallery
- improvement to staff change rooms
- miscellaneous improvements to various ancillary mechanical, electrical and controls systems throughout the plant
as well as
The demolition, modification and rehabilitation of the existing buried on-site reservoir and construction of a new surge tank and overflow tank including:
- the rehabilitation of the overflow discharge line and outfall structure to Lake Ontario
- overall site works to restore the grounds to a shared space with Toronto Water and the community
Summary

entrydata.name: SiteMeeting
entrydata.text: Mandatory Site Meeting, December 20, 2023 at 10am at Scarborough Pump Station, 21 Fishleigh Dr, Toronto

entrydata.name: AllAttachments
entrydata.text: []Doc4328129808 - NOIP.pdf[ ] (282 Kbytes) 12/11/2023

entrydata.name: ShortDescription
entrydata.text: Highland Creek Treatment Plant Firm Capacity Upgrades

textlist.text: This RFT is an invitation by the City to the following pre-qualified Suppliers for the Firm Capacity Upgrades consisting of the new North East Plant, a new plant entrance and access road, new influent conduits and pipelines, new medium voltage hydro power supply, a new substation and standby diesel generator, and long term rehabilitation of the North West Plant and the South West Plant to submit bids for the performance of the Work, as further described in Part 3 (DRAWINGS AND SPECIFICATIONS) and the Contract:
 Alberici Constructors, Ltd
 Kenaidan Contracting Ltd.
 Maple Reinders Constructors Ltd.
 North America Construction (1993) Ltd.
Only the Bids received from the Suppliers identified above shall be considered by the City.
The major works forming this RFT are the following:
• selective demolition of various existing infrastructure throughout the facility,
• bulk excavation and deep foundation installation for the new 110MLD wastewater treatment facility,
• the complete construction of a 110MLD wastewater treatment facility to be known as the North East Plant, a new site entrance and access road, conduits and pipelines,
• the construction of a new 27.6KV electrical substation with medium voltage hydro power supply,
• the construction of a new North West South West Blower Building and Polymer Building,
• Demolition of the Heat Treatment Building,
• long term rehabilitation of the existing HCTP North West Plant and the South West Plants.
Summary
.1 Optional Site Meeting

.1 Suppliers are recommended to attend an optional site meeting to familiarize themselves with the Project and ascertain the full extent of the Work required. The optional site meeting will take place at Highland Creek Treatment Plant (meet at the entrance), 10:00 am local time on February 6, 2024 at 51 Beechgrove Drive, Scarborough, Toronto. The site meeting will be held in the Plant Training Room. (Directions will be posted via Ariba). The site meeting will include a presentation outlining the work and a site walk.
.2 Additional Site Meeting

.1 The City is prepared to host an additional site meeting on a date and time to be determined to provide a walkthrough with the main focus on the electrical aspects of the work. An addendum will be issued to confirm the date, time and details of the additional site meeting.

.3 Suppliers must meet all personal protective equipment (PPE) requirements prior to the meeting. Hard hats, high visibility vests or clothing and CSA-approved safety boots are mandatory for the site walk. Suppliers without the appropriate PPE will not be allowed to participate in the site walk.
.4 All Suppliers must sign in at the designated signing area prior to the site meeting.

.5 Suppliers must complete the Health & Safety Orientation Sign Off form attached to this RFT and must submit it to the Procurement Contact named above via email prior to the site visit. The Contractor Visitor HCTP H&S Orientation Package and the HCTP H&S Orientation Sign Off Form can be found in Part 3 as attachments 14 and 15, respectively.
.6 Site meetings will not be available at any other times.

.7 No statement or information provided in such meeting by either the City or the Suppliers will amend any provision of this RFT or the Contract or may be relied upon by a Supplier in the RFT process or its Bid, except and to the extent such statement or information is later confirmed through the issuance of an Addendum.

entrydata.name: ShortDescription
entrydata.text: Sanitary Forcemain Replacement Project Group 2 – Phase 2A

textlist.text: This contract includes Work at two (2) Sewage Pumping Stations (SPS) in the City of Toronto, namely, Island Road SPS and Skydome SPS. There are the following Works, in general, to be performed at these SPS:
Island Road SPS:
- Approximately 272 m of Twin 200 mm diameter Forcemains installation on Island Road from the SPS to the proposed Discharge Maintenance Hole at Brownfield Gardens, and
- Processing, Structural, Electrical, Mechanical, and Instrumentation Work inside the Pumping Station.
Skydome SPS:
- Approximately 190 m of 300 mm diameter of Primary Forcemain on Navy Wharf Ct and Blue Jays Way including proposed Discharge Maintenance Hole, and Valve Chambers,
- Approximately 100 m of Twin 350 mm diameter Forcemains on Blue Jays Way including the installation at the underside of the Bridge over the Metrolinx Tracks and Expansion Joint Chambers, and
- Processing, Structural, and Electrical Work inside the Pumping Station.

Additionally, this contract also includes in general: A pre-construction survey of all properties and CCTV inspection of existing sewers and maintenance holes prior to the commencement of the Work, abandonment and/or removal of existing pipes, temporary bypassing of the SPS during the Work, testing and commissioning of the installed forcemains, and Permanent Restoration.
Summary

entrydata.name: SiteMeeting
entrydata.text: Optional Site Visit: January 9, 2024 @ 10:00 A.M. – Skydome SPS (For details, please refer to Part 1 - Request for Tenders, Section 1.6)

textlist.text: This Request for Quotation (the “RFQ”) is an invitation by the City of Toronto (the “City”) to prospective Suppliers to submit bids for the non-exclusive supply and delivery of Fire Fighting Equipment, Tools, Lighting, Specialty Rescue Tools, Rescue Rope Equipment, and related Equipment for the City of Toronto's Fire Services Division, as further described in Part 3 and the Contract (the “Deliverables”).

.3 The Successful Supplier will be required to either (i) execute a Contract, or (ii) acknowledge the Contract as contained in the City's purchase order for the provision of the Deliverables. Suppliers should review the terms and conditions set out in Part 2 (FORM OF AGREEMENT) to understand the Contract being entered into with the City. It is the City’s intention to enter Contracts with up to ten (10) potential separate legal entities, based on the Supplier being the lowest total bid price meeting specifications, for each Price Form, i.e., Table A to Table J, associated with this RFQ:
Table A - Nozzles
Table B - Fittings
Table C - Lighting
Table D - Firefighting Equipment
Table E - Safety Ladders
Table F - Water Rescue Equipment
Table G - Rescue Ropes
Table H - FDC-Standpipe Kit
Table I - Stihl ® Equipment & Generators
Table J - Ventilation Fans
http://discovery.ariba.com/rfx/18426102
Summary

entrydata.name: ShortDescription
entrydata.text: RFSQ Roster List for Fairness Monitor

textlist.text: This Request for Supplier Qualifications ("RFSQ") is an invitation by the City of Toronto ("the City") to establish a Roster of pre-qualified candidates for City procurements that require the services of a Fairness Monitor on an “as and when required” basis to be determined solely by the City. The Roster will be in effect for an initial period of three (3) years from the day of its establishment. The City will have the option to renew the Roster with any or all of the Successful Respondents for an additional two (2), one (1) year terms. The maximum period that this RFSQ will be in effect is five (5) years.

The option to renew the Roster for up to two (2), one (1) year terms will be based on formal City review of the performance level of Fairness Monitors on Work Assignments completed over the prior year. The City will be under no obligation to exercise any renewal option. Each year of the contract term the City reserves the right to review the prequalified list of Fairness Monitors and if at any time the City observes the list is not sufficient to handle the workload, then additional Fairness Monitors may be added following the process in Part 5 Section 2.4.4.
https://discovery.ariba.com/rfx/18156075
Summary

entrydata.name: ShortDescription
entrydata.text: Parallel Operation of Standby Natural Gas Generators and Gas Monitoring at the F.J. Horgan Water Treatment Plant

textlist.text: Summary
Mandatory Site Meeting:
1. Suppliers are required to attend one (1) mandatory meeting to
familiarize themselves with the required Deliverables. The mandatory
meeting will take place as noted below. The site meeting will not be
available at any other time.
2. F.J. Horgan Water Treatment Plant, 201 Copperfield Road,
Toronto, ON M1E 3T9, from 11:00 AM – 12:00 PM local Toronto
time on November 30, 2023. Attendees to meet at the Front
Entrance (South Parking Lot).
3. Suppliers must advise the Procurement Contact via email at
least three (3) working days prior to the site meeting and
provide the name and contact information (telephone/email
address) of the personnel that will be attending.
4. Suppliers must sign the attendance sheet at the mandatory
meeting during the designated date and time for their Bid to be
considered. Bids submitted by Suppliers that do not attend the
mandatory meeting or fail to sign the attendance sheet shall be
declared non-compliant.
5. The Supplier Representatives must provide their own personal
protective equipment (PPE) prior to the meeting. Mandatory PPE
includes hard hat, high visibility vest and safety boots (minimum
CSA Green Patch).
6. No statement or information provided in such meeting by either the
City or the Suppliers will amend any provision of this RFT or the
Contract, or may be relied upon by a Supplier in the RFT process
or its Bid, except and to the extent such statement or information
is later confirmed through the issuance of an Addendum.

entrydata.text: City Hall, 100 Queen Street West, Toronto ON

textlist.text: This Request for Supplier Qualifications ("RFSQ") is an invitation by the City of Toronto ("the City") to prospective Respondents to qualify for future eligibility to provide property appraisal services for insurance purposes on a variety of insured buildings establish values representing the replacement cost/cost of reproduction including the amount required to reproduce property with that of like kind and quality in accordance with current market prices for materials, labor, equipment, duties, freight, contractor’s overhead, profit and fees.

Respondents will serve as a qualified resource for the City when requesting insurance appraisal services for a period of three (3) years with the option, at the sole and absolute discretion of the City, to extend the period for up to two (2) one (1)-year optional periods, for a potential total of five (5) years.
Summary
